translations: n.<英> （因劳动力过剩而造成的）裁员，解雇；多余，累赘；复置装置，冗余（机器、系统等某部件发生故障后的替代装置）

phrs.translation: 冗余核对；过剩信息校验

sentences.sentence: Thousands of bank employees are facing redundancy as their employers cut costs.
sentences.translation: 数千名银行职员面临裁员，因为他们的雇主要削减成本。

sentences.sentence: Avoid redundancy: Define an item in the glossary or in the domain model, but not in both.
sentences.translation: 避免冗余：在术语表或域模型中定义一个条目，但是不要在两者里面都下定义。

sentences.sentence: If there's enough redundancy in the brain so that even if your right hemisphere got destroyed, your left hemisphere still has all the same memories.
sentences.translation: 如果大脑有足够冗余，即使你的右半球被破坏了，你的左半球仍然有相同的记忆。
